page.title: 11CANONS PARK, EDGWARE
page.content: Canons Park is all that remains of the huge Chandos Estate. The First Duke of Chandos had been Paymaster to the Duke of Marlborough during the Dutch Wars. He bought 500 acres of parkland from the profits he made in this post and in it built a sumptuous house, Canons. He also rebuilt St. Lawrence's Church in Continental Baroque style. Handel was patronised by the Duke and wrote much of his early music at Canons. Canons did not long survive the Duke. It was sold off, then destroyed by fire. A cabinet-maker, William Hallat, built the present house which now forms part of North London Collegiate School. The vegetable garden became the King George Memorial Gardens. The School was founded by Mary Beale, a pioneer of girls' education.
